verses.roman:
patra paḍiyā prabhura mane haila duḥkha
bāhire hāsiyā kichu bale candra-mukha

synonyms: patra—note; paḍiyā—reading; prabhura—of Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; mane—in the mind; haila—became; duḥkha—unhappiness; bāhire—externally; hāsiyā—smiling; kichu—something; bale—says; candra-mukha—the moon-faced.
translation: Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu became unhappy upon reading the note, although His face still shone as brightly as the moon. Thus, smiling, He spoke as follows.
